required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Non-interventional European Study of Trabectedin + PLD in the Treatment of Relapsed Ovarian Cancer (ROC) Patients
clinical_study.official_title: NonInterventional, Multicenter, Prospective, European Study to Describe the Effectiveness of Trabectedin + PLD in the Treatment of Relapsed Ovarian Cancer (ROC) Patients According to SmPC Regardless of Previous Use of an Antiangiogenic Drug

brief_summary.textblock: Non-interventional, multicenter, prospective, European study to describe the effectiveness of trabectedin + PLD in the treatment of relapsed ovarian cancer (ROC) patients according to SmPC regardless of previous use of an antiangiogenic drug

primary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 to the earliest date of disease progression as reported by the investigator or death, up to 4.5 years (Jan 2015 to Sept 2019)
primary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as time (in months) from Day 1 to the earliest date of disease progression as reported by the investigator or death, regardless of cause, (whichever is first). Patients with no reported disease progression and alive were censored at last contact date/last date known alive. PFS was calculated as the date of progressive disease or death minus date of Day 1, and the result in days was converted to months. All tumor assessment dates were based on the actual imaging dates reported by the investigator. Progressive disease (PD) defined as at least a 20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival by Prior Antiangiogenic Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 to the earliest date of disease progression as reported by the investigator or death, up to 4.5 years (Jan 2015 to Sept 2019)
primary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as time (in months) from Day 1 to the earliest date of disease progression as reported by the investigator or death, regardless of cause, (whichever is first). Patients with no reported disease progression and alive were censored at last contact date/last date known alive. PFS was calculated as the date of progressive disease or death minus date of Day 1, and the result in days was converted to months. All tumor assessment dates were based on the actual imaging dates reported by the investigator. Progressive disease (PD) defined as at least a 20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival by BRCA1/2 Status
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 to the earliest date of disease progression as reported by the investigator or death, up to 4.5 years (Jan 2015 to Sept 2019)
primary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as time (in months) from Day 1 to the earliest date of disease progression as reported by the investigator or death, regardless of cause, (whichever is first). Patients with no reported disease progression and alive were censored at last contact date/last date known alive. PFS was calculated as the date of progressive disease or death minus date of Day 1, and the result in days was converted to months. All tumor assessment dates were based on the actual imaging dates reported by the investigator. Progressive disease (PD) defined as at least a 20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival by Platinum Sensitivity
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 to the earliest date of disease progression as reported by the investigator or death, up to 4.5 years (Jan 2015 to Sept 2019)
primary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as time (in months) from Day 1 to the earliest date of disease progression as reported by the investigator or death, regardless of cause, (whichever is first). Patients with no reported disease progression and alive were censored at last contact date/last date known alive. PFS was calculated as the date of progressive disease or death minus date of Day 1, and the result in days was converted to months. All tumor assessment dates were based on the actual imaging dates reported by the investigator. Progressive disease (PD) defined as at least a 20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 of study treatment to end of study, up to 4.5 years (Jan 2015 to Sept 2019)
secondary_outcome.description: Complete response (CR): Disappearance of all target lesions; Partial response (PR): At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum LD; Stable disease (SD): Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, taking as reference the smallest sum LD since the treatment started; Progressive disease (PD): At least a 20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Response by Prior Antiangiogenic Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 of study treatment to end of study, up to 4.5 years (Jan 2015 to Sept 2019)
secondary_outcome.description: Complete response (CR): Disappearance of all target lesions; Partial response (PR): At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum LD; Stable disease (SD): Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, taking as reference the smallest sum LD since the treatment started; Progressive disease (PD): At least a 20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 to death, up to 4.5 years (Jan 2015 to Sept 2019)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Survival time was calculated as the number of days from Day 1 to death. Time to death was summarized in months. Patients who did not die (no record of death) or were lost to follow up were censored at the date of last contact/last date known alive.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival by Prior Antiangiogenic Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 to death, up to 4.5 years (Jan 2015 to Sept 2019)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Survival time was calculated as the number of days from Day 1 to death. Time to death was summarized in months. Patients who did not die (no record of death) or were lost to follow up were censored at the date of last contact/last date known alive.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 to death, up to 4.5 years (Jan 2015 to Sept 2019)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Survival time was calculated as the number of days from Day 1 to death. Time to death was summarized in months. Patients who did not die (no record of death) or were lost to follow up were censored at the date of last contact/last date known alive.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 to death, up to 4.5 years (Jan 2015 to Sept 2019)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Survival time was calculated as the number of days from Day 1 to death. Time to death was summarized in months. Patients who did not die (no record of death) or were lost to follow up were censored at the date of last contact/last date known alive.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Best Post-baseline ECOG Performance Status Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 4.5 years (Jan 2015 to Sept 2019)
secondary_outcome.description: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status (ECOG): 0 Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction; 1 Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature; 2 Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours; 3 Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours; 4 Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair; 5 Dead

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Best Post-baseline ECOG Performance Status Score by Prior Antiangiogenic Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 4.5 years (Jan 2015 to Sept 2019)
secondary_outcome.description: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status (ECOG): 0 Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction; 1 Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature; 2 Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours; 3 Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours; 4 Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair; 5 Dead

study_pop.textblock: Patients with platinum-sensitive relapsed ovarian cancer who are receiving trabectedin + PLD according to SmPC.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women aged 18 years or older.
- Presence of platinum-sensitive relapsed ovarian cancer.
- Treatment and treated indication according to local label SmPC and reimbursement for trabectedin and PLD treatment.
- Prior treatment with a minimum of 1 cycle of trabectedin + PLD according to SmPC before inclusion in the study, and no more than 3 previous treatment lines.
- Written informed consent indicating that patients understand the purpose and procedures and are willing to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

facility.name: Centre d'Oncologie et de Radiothérapie du Parc
Clinique Victor Hugo - Centre Jean Bernard
Strasbourg Oncologie Libérale Centre de radiothérapie
Uniklinik Homburg - Klinik Für Frauenheilkunde, Geburtshilfe und Reproduktionsmedizin
Franziskus-Hospital Harderberg Internistische Onkologie und Hämatologie
Instirtut für klinische Forschung (IKF) Städtisches Klinikum München GmbH
Policlinico Universitario Monserrato - Presidio Policlinico Duilio Casula
Istituto Tumori Giovanni Paolo II IRCCS
Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli Università Cattolica di Roma

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 220 patients treated according to standard local clinical practice in 57 sites across Italy, Spain, Germany, France, and Belgium have been enrolled in the study. The first patient was included in the study on 28 July 2015. Data were collected between 26 January 2015, date of first patient trabectedin administration (prior treatment before inclusion in the study) and 18 September 2019, date of last patient last visit.

group.title: Prior Use of Antiangiogenics
group.description: Patients who used a prior Antiangiogenics defined as type of therapy reported in the CRF categorized as "antiangiogenic" by the investigator or prior treatment reported by the investigator being bevacizumab (or Avastin®), pazopanib, or trabananib

group.title: No Prior Use of Antiangiogenics
group.description: Antiangiogenics-naïve Patients. Antiangiogenics defined as type of therapy reported in the CRF categorized as "antiangiogenic" by the investigator or prior treatment reported by the investigator being bevacizumab (or Avastin®), pazopanib, or trabananib

baseline.population: 2 patients enrolled did not receive PLD

group.title: Prior Use of Antiangiogenics

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: Histopathology at initial ovarian cancer diagnosis
ECOG performance status
measure.description: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status: 0 Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction; 1 Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature; 2 Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours; 3 Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours; 4 Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair; 5 Dead

measure.title: Best response to prior therapy regimen
measure.description: Complete response (CR): Disappearance of all target lesions; Partial response (PR): At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum LD; Stable disease (SD): Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, taking as reference the smallest sum LD since the treatment started; Progressive disease (PD): At least a 20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival
outcome.description: PFS was defined as time (in months) from Day 1 to the earliest date of disease progression as reported by the investigator or death, regardless of cause, (whichever is first). Patients with no reported disease progression and alive were censored at last contact date/last date known alive. PFS was calculated as the date of progressive disease or death minus date of Day 1, and the result in days was converted to months. All tumor assessment dates were based on the actual imaging dates reported by the investigator. Progressive disease (PD) defined as at least a 20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 to the earliest date of disease progression as reported by the investigator or death, up to 4.5 years (Jan 2015 to Sept 2019)

group.title: Full Analysis Set
group.description: The full analysis set consisted of all the patients enrolled into the study and who had at least one administration of T + PLD.

group.title: Fully Platinum Sensitivity
group.description: Cancer that responds Fully to treatment with anticancer drugs that contain the metal platinum, such as cisplatin and carboplatin.

group.title: Partially Platinum Sensitivity
group.description: Cancer that responds Partially to treatment with anticancer drugs that contain the metal platinum, such as cisplatin and carboplatin.

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Overall Survival time was calculated as the number of days from Day 1 to death. Time to death was summarized in months. Patients who did not die (no record of death) or were lost to follow up were censored at the date of last contact/last date known alive.

reported_events.time_frame: From Day 1 of study treatment to 30 days post last dose of study treatment, up to 4.5 years (Jan 2015 to Sept 2019)
reported_events.desc: Two patients were excluded from the safety set because of missing PLD treatment data

group.description: Patients who used a prior Antiangiogenics defined as type of therapy reported in the CRF categorized as "antiangiogenic" by the investigator or prior treatment reported by the investigator being bevacizumab (or Avastin®), pazopanib, or trabananib

group.description: Antiangiogenics-naïve Patients. Antiangiogenics defined as type of therapy reported in the CRF categorized as "antiangiogenic" by the investigator or prior treatment reported by the investigator being bevacizumab (or Avastin®), pazopanib, or trabananib

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Clinical Developtment, Department of PharmaMar´s Oncology., Business Unit.
